blog.name: humandisasterrewiews
blog.title: welcome to my unwanted opinions
blog.description: read what I have to say about some movies if you please.

body:
Unicorn Store

It’s been a couple of years after the release of this movie. However, I have just finished watching it.

To be honest, at first I wasn’t really sure I would like this movie (even though Brie Larson and Samuel L. Jackson were starring). And I still felt that way at the beginning, except for the “videos” of her childhood, I enjoyed that.

I usually cry on movies, I can’t help it, but this one really touched me. I can’t describe exactly what, although Brie Larson’s acting helped my tears to show up almost every scene that was meant to be touching.

I felt inspired by this picture. I know I am young, but I felt like a little kid again. It also inspired me to be myself, childish or not, a dreamer or not.

I recommend this movie a 100%, if you don’t like it (or don’t think you will), at least you’ll see a cute unicorn.

Remember that this is MY opinion. And I totally respect yours.

Also, that I am an English student, so I’m not that good yet, but I’ll get there (if you see something misspelled or wrong, let me know and I’ll fix it).

Thanks for reading my unwanted opinion. See y'all soon.

tags: idk why i made this post
im just getting really tired of the hate towards her
honestly i thought the movie was medicore
i liked it but its no where near my fave marvel movie
and idk much about brie larson bc i havent watched her interviews or anything
summary: a lot of the hate for brie larson and captain marvel seems to be about the fact that she acts too feminist or too strong....
body: a lot of the hate for brie larson and captain marvel seems to be about the fact that she acts too feminist or too strong. honestly, it seems to be very similar to when people are like “i dont have a problem with gay people as long as they dont act too gay” or  “i dont have a problem with black people as long as they dont act too black.” people always cite the fact that they dont have a problem with other female superheroes but dont like captain marvel because of her feminism. people do the same with poc or lgtbq+ characters. like race, sexuality, sex, or whatever plays a big role in someones identity. you cant act too whatever because it is who you are. like any character ever, they have traits that define them and make them who they are. so what if some people fall into stereotypes or really embrace and express that part of their identity? why is that a bad thing? why is it so bad that people have pride in who they are? people are really pissing me off trying to justify their bigotry. its okay to not like her character but if you dislike a character because of qualities that belong to or define a minority group, then thats a bit iffy.

summary: Had a dream last night that Brie Larson carried me (bridal style, effortlessly) from one part of an event (a dinner maybe?) to...
body: Had a dream last night that Brie Larson carried me (bridal style, effortlessly) from one part of an event (a dinner maybe?) to another (an auditorium of sorts), and then sat and chatted for a few minutes before going off to do her part of the event (perform or speak or something i’m sure), promising to be back later. We may have been dating, I’m not sure. Either way, it was amazing and she was amazing and how did i not realize i’m bi sooner?

reblog.comment: Had a dream last night that Brie Larson carried me (bridal style, effortlessly) from one part of an event (a dinner maybe?) to another (an auditorium of sorts), and then sat and chatted for a few minutes before going off to do her part of the event (perform or speak or something i’m sure), promising to be back later. We may have been dating, I’m not sure. Either way, it was amazing and she was amazing and how did i not realize i’m bi sooner?

tags: if you have never listened to this song you def missed out a bunch of good shit
summary: So... real talk guys: I have known Brie Larson for about 14 years but not because I watched some of her early movies, but...
body:
So… real talk guys: I have known Brie Larson for about 14 years but not because I watched some of her early movies, but because she sang that super ass memorable song ‘Hope Has Wings’ for the corresponding Barbie movie: Magic of Pegasus. Now she out there fighting for love and justice as Captain Marvel I call it growth???!!!

Just saying that this is my jam to this day and I love the fact that she was born the same day I was born, just nine years earlier. Fate.
